dialogue: Did you get the replacement license?
Yeah, I got it.
Good, because you shouldn’t be driving without that. You’ll end up in a database--
What is it with you and databases all of a sudden?
You don’t want to end up in one.
I’m just saying I think this can be handled. Maybe I can handle it.
What are you proposing?
...I’ll call everyday. I’ll come over more, make sure she wears her Lyfe Line--
No, no I have it. But I’m not seeing my ID...
You’re not even looking, you’re just patting--
I did! I just--
Don’t lie. Just tell us you didn’t. I’d rather know than be lied to.
...I haven’t. Yet!
I knew it. Daniel, this is very bad!
Thank you... everyone.
It’s a simple thing.
You aren’t acting like you understand, you’re not a kid anymore. These are the basics of adult life--
Dad! You’re embarrassing me in front of... Rochelle! And Colin.
Enhancing.
I see gas pumps, some kind of blue car, a pigeon, two pigeons maybe--
There’s someone behind us.
I see them.
There’s a gap!
Back to 12 minutes.
Can you get a location?
She’s still here!
I told her not to take it off.
Acute onset of anterograde amnesia, cognitive impairment--
I can’t remember if it was on her wrist. In the car...
Absence of signs indicating damage to a particular area of the brain--
I should have walked her in.
Hey! Don’t yell--
I’m sorry! I’m upset!
This is different than Gelson’s--

I’m aware it’s different but the point is she’s a grown woman who’s a little faster than you’d hope and you can’t be responsible for her every second of every day. We shouldn’t have put that on you. It was too much.
...I know she’s not going to live forever. When it happens I just want it to be... not horrific, you know? Like a good death.
There is no good death.
I’m gonna take a walk.
I did.
You... “went back to the buffet.”
